title: Holly's Hill 2016 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)
description: This unusually lively and vivid wine offers a nice twist on the variety, offering fresh pineapple, herb and lemon flavors, dazzling acidity and great balance despite its relatively high level of alcohol. Grown on the winery property, it's another good example of Holly's Hill's emphasis on purity of flavor.

title: I Favati 2015 Pietramara  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: Linear and bright, this has aromas suggesting yellow flower, citrus zest and a smoky whiff of flint. On the palate, hints dried herb accent pineapple and lemon alongside a mineral vein.

title: Doqi 2014 Qveri Rkatsiteli (Georgia)
description: Light amber in the glass, this wine offers a bouquet of stone fruit and white flowers. It is round on the palate with flavors of apricot, peach, flint and white chocolate. Tannins that enter softly stiffen up just before the smooth, bright finish.

title: Duorum 2016 Tons de Duorum White (Douro)
description: It is probably the small soupçon of Moscatel in the blend that gives this wine its irresistible perfumed character. That just brings out the fine acidity and the crisp citrus flavors. It is a refreshing wine, as aromatic at the end as at the beginning. Drink now.

title: Owen Roe 2015 Ex Umbris Syrah (Yakima Valley)
description: Nuanced aromas of red fruit, herb, smoked meat and spice are followed by a full-flavored palate that seems tart, almost sour at times. Some rough edges still need to be rounded out but this wine has good stuffing.

title: Ribbon Cliff 2013 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The variety is unmistakable here, with aromas of savory herb mixed with cherry and accented by sweet barrel spices. Flavors are light, dry and reserved in style, with abundant barrel accents that prove a bit distracting.

title: Robert Karcher et Fils 2015 Harth Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Tender notes of freshly cut juicy pear appear on the nose. The palate portrays the same appetizing fruit on a taut easy palate. The slight residual sweetness just boosts fruit flavors but still finishes dry.

title: Rock Wall 2015 Alegria Vineyard Ancient Vines Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From a block planted in 1890 interspersed with dozens of field blend varieties, this wine is ripely sweet with baked cherry fruit, a smoky undercurrent and a soft, moderately balanced structure. Coffee, cinnamon and nutmeg power the finish.

title: Pianetta 2014 Syrah (Monterey)
description: Blackberry syrup, thyme and charred meat scents show on the nose of this wine from a hot sector of Monterey. The palate starts with somewhat sweet candied berry flavors then grows sour with plum skin tartness, dusted with rich mocha and latte accents.

title: Pierre Sparr 2015 Grande Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: A restrained touch of peach mingles with an appealing bitterness on the nose. The palate adds a bright lemon freshness and a pithy texture. The finish is clean, just dry and appetizing.

title: Quintas de Melgaço 2016 Torre de Menagem Escolha Alvarinho-Trajadura White (Vinho Verde)
description: A blend of two of Vinho Verde's major grapes, the wine has a rich content as well as fine textured minerality. There is plenty of acidity in this dry wine to give it a crisp edge and a concentrated aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Orbelus 2011 Getika Made With Organic Grapes Red (Thracian Lowlands)
description: This blend is comprised of 55% Merlot, 21% Cabernet Sauvignon, 18% Melnik and 6% Petit Verdot. It has aromas of powdered cocoa and black cherry and flavors of tart cherry, blackberry and blueberry. A pleasant burst of acidity shows on the finish.

title: Orbelus 2012 Getika Made With Organic Grapes Red (Thracian Lowlands)
description: Enticing aromas of blueberry syrup open this blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Melnik, Syrah and Petit Verdot. Flavors of cherry, tart cherry pie, blueberry and red raspberry come with a burst of acidity before the persistent finish.

title: Orbelus 2013 Hrumki Syrah Melnik 55 Mourvèdre Marselan Red (Thracian Lowlands)
description: This dark-garnet wine has aromas of eucalyptus, balsa wood and black cherry. Flavors of cassis, leather and black cherry lead to a long finish.

title: Ross-idi 2014 Nikolaevo Unfiltered Rubin (Thracian Lowlands)
description: This garnet-colored wine made from Rubin, an indigenous Bulgarian variety, has aromas of canned cranberry sauce and mint jelly with delightful flavors of cranberry and pomegranate juice. The finish is juicy and fruit filled.

title: Owl Ridge 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Almost black in color, this wine shows persistent oak and green notes, accented with cedar, graphite and dust. The tannins are dry and woody, contributing to its food-friendliness.

title: Paraduxx 2013 Rector Creek Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blend of equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Zinfandel from the same site is a complex aromatic display of clove and bay. Simple and succulent, it's full-bodied and densely concentrated, emphasizing blackberry and strawberry flavors.

title: Paul Anheuser 2015 Schlossböckelheimer Königsfels Kabinett Riesling (Nahe)
description: Intensely earthy, savory tones juxtapose sweet tangerine and apple in this delicately concentrated yet lip-smackingly honeyed kabinett. The finish is refreshingly brisk and lemony. Drink now.

title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2015 Q de Sant'Ana Pinot Noir (Lisboa)
description: This is defiantly cool climate Pinot Noir. Its raspberry and red-cherry fruits are right up front, crisp and cool with acidity and gentle tannins. The fruit dominates this still young wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Stone Castle 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Rahoveci Valley)
description: This wine offers aromas of jasmine, talcum powder, violet and vanilla. It has good mouthfeel, with flavors of apple, pineapple and peach leading to a clean finish.

title: Sueño 2014 Tempranillo (Ribera del Júcar)
description: This wine's ripe berry aromas include integrated oak, tar and vanilla notes. Its plum, raspberry, vanilla and cream flavors are appealing, yet it finishes raw, jagged and a bit shrill.

title: Sweetzer Cellars 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Broad red and black plum aromas meet thyme and Earl Grey touches on the nose of this county blend from a Los Angeles-based producer. The flavors are familiar and easy, with tart and tangy red fruit and a touch of caramelization on the finish.

title: Joseph Fritsch 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: An almost creamy wave of pear fruit hits the nose. The palate is equally soft and full fruited, boosted by residual sweetness that makes the fruit fluid and rounded. This is countered by ample zesty freshness that has a pithy slightly bitter edge. The finish is just off dry and clean.

title: Sleight of Hand 2015 The Conjurer Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (63%), Cabernet Franc (28%), Merlot (8%) and Petit Verdot coming largely from Red Mountain and Phinny Hill vineyards. Aromas are vibrant, with notes of plum, char, red apple, cherry, blueberry, green herb and spice. The appealing blue-fruit flavors are lighter in style.

title: Snoqualmie 2015 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Bright aromas of fresh pear and melon are followed by a medium-bodied palate that sails right down the fairway. It's a guaranteed crowd pleaser.

title: Teliani Valley 2014 Mukuzani Saperavi (Kakheti)
description: This dark violet-red wine has a nose of blackberry and rose petal. Full on the palate, it offers flavors of black cherry, cranberry, chocolate and a touch of smoke. There is a pervading sense of brightness throughout, although sneaky tannins provide for a hint of chalkiness on the finish.

title: Sipun 2015 Zlahtina (Krk)
description: This wine from the island of Krk is straw colored, with aromas of apple blossom, green apple and lemon zest. It is well weighted in the mouth, with flavors of apple and citrus blossom and a creamy finish.

title: Longevity 2015 Sandy Bend Vineyard Muscat Canelli (Lake County)
description: Rose petal aromas and sweet lychee, honey and marascino cherry flavors make this a colorful, exuberant wine. The texture feels thick and luxurious, the acidity is soft, and a mouth-coating viscosity helps the outrageous floral quality linger on the finish.

title: Liberty Lake 2012 Petit Verdot (Red Mountain)
description: Light, high-toned aromas of potting soil and purple flowers are followed by lemon-twist flavors and a wall of burly tannins. It's a bit brusque on its own but will show better with food.

title: Loma Larga 2014 Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)
description: Edgy slightly sharp aromas of herbal berry fruits, olive and eucalyptus set up a tight rough palate. Big-time herbal flavors are oaky and taste of leafy black fruits and olive. This powerful Cab Franc finishes with woody notes of mint along with herbal berry and leftover eucalyptus nut flavors.
